title: Child mortality from respiratory infections vs. access to clean fuels for cooking
subtitle: Mortality rate of children under five years old from lower respiratory infections, measured as the number of deaths per 100,000. This is shown against the share of the population with access to clean fuels for cooking and heating. Lack of access to clean fuels results in high levels of indoor air pollution â€“ a key risk factor for respiratory infections.

display.name: Access to clean fuels and technologies for cooking

sourceDesc: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2019); World Bank
